title: Ancient Leaders Recall
description: Test your memory of the great leaders who shaped the ancient world!

questions.question: Which ancient leader conquered most of the known world by age 30?
questions.explanation: Alexander the Great of Macedonia conquered an empire stretching from Greece to northwestern India by the time he was 30 years old.

questions.question: Who was the first Emperor of the Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: Augustus (born Octavian) became the first Roman Emperor in 27 BC after defeating Mark Antony and Cleopatra.

questions.question: Which Egyptian pharaoh is known for building the Great Pyramid of Giza?
questions.explanation: Pharaoh Khufu (also known as Cheops) commissioned the Great Pyramid of Giza around 2560 BC.

questions.question: Who founded the Persian Empire, the largest empire the world had seen at that time?
questions.explanation: Cyrus the Great founded the Achaemenid Persian Empire around 550 BC, known for his respect for the customs and religions of conquered peoples.

questions.question: Which Carthaginian general famously crossed the Alps with elephants to attack Rome?
questions.explanation: Hannibal Barca crossed the Alps with war elephants in 218 BC during the Second Punic War, one of the most audacious military maneuvers in history.

questions.question: Who was the legendary first king of Rome?
questions.explanation: According to Roman legend, Romulus founded Rome in 753 BC and became its first king after killing his twin brother Remus.

questions.question: Which Chinese emperor unified China and began construction of the Great Wall?
questions.explanation: Qin Shi Huang became the first Emperor of a unified China in 221 BC and initiated the construction of the Great Wall.

questions.question: Who was the Athenian leader credited with establishing democracy in Athens?
questions.explanation: Cleisthenes introduced democratic reforms in Athens around 508 BC and is often called the 'father of Athenian democracy.'

questions.question: Which queen of Egypt formed alliances with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony?
questions.explanation: Cleopatra VII, the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, formed political and romantic alliances with both Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

questions.question: Who was the Spartan king who led 300 warriors at the Battle of Thermopylae?
questions.explanation: King Leonidas I of Sparta led approximately 300 Spartans (and other Greek allies) against the massive Persian army at Thermopylae in 480 BC.

questions.question: Which Indian emperor converted to Buddhism and spread it across Asia?
questions.explanation: Emperor Ashoka of the Maurya dynasty converted to Buddhism after the bloody Kalinga War and became one of history's greatest advocates for peace and dharma.

questions.question: Who was the Macedonian king and father of Alexander the Great?
questions.explanation: Philip II of Macedon transformed Macedonia into a major military power and laid the groundwork for his son Alexander's conquests.

questions.question: Which Roman general crossed the Rubicon River, sparking a civil war?
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar crossed the Rubicon River in 49 BC with his army, defying the Roman Senate and triggering a civil war that would end the Roman Republic.

questions.question: Who was the Babylonian king famous for his code of laws?
questions.explanation: Hammurabi, King of Babylon (reigned c. 1792-1750 BC), created one of the earliest and most complete written legal codes in history.

questions.question: Which Roman Emperor made Christianity the official religion of the Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: Emperor Theodosius I made Christianity the official state religion of the Roman Empire in 380 AD with the Edict of Thessalonica.
